title: Trigonometric Identity
text: Use the trigonometric identity $${cos}^2 \theta=1-{sin}^2 \theta$$ to find the antiderivative.
speech: Use the trigonometric identity  cosine squared of theta, is equal to, 1 minus sine squared of theta  to find the antiderivative.
pacedSpeech: Use the trigonometric identity   cosine squared of theta, is equal to, 1 minus sine squared of theta

title: Constant of Integration
text: Since we are determining the indefinite integral, we will be including the constant of integration C at the end of our answer.
speech: Since we are determining the indefinite integral, we will be including the constant of integration C at the end of our answer.
pacedSpeech: Since we are determining the indefinite integral, we will be including the constant of integration C at the end of our answer.
